definition: to return/to go back
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
to rove around/to run around in circles/to walk back and forth

sentences.english: He loafed about the street looking for something to do.
sentences.chinese: 他在街上转来转去，想找点事做。

sentences.english: Li Busu was familiar with the route so they made rapid progress. He turned this way and that through open crevices .
sentences.chinese: 李不俗驾轻就熟，在那些嵌裂透漏的缝隙中钻来转去。

sentences.english: The log twiddled round and round in the river.
sentences.chinese: 那根圆木在河水中转来转去。
那扇沉重的门向内转去。

sentences.english: For there he can maneuver you onto all fours.
sentences.chinese: 他于是就转来转去，你还可以四肢趴着。

sentences.english: Sell the gold back and put the money towards a new style.
sentences.chinese: 你应该把黄金卖回去，折现转去买新样式。

sentences.english: His glance roved the boy sitting by the window.
sentences.chinese: 他的目光转来转去地看着坐在窗户旁边的男孩。

sentences.english: Don't stop, so the beast's upstream instead.
sentences.chinese: 转来转去不停止，于是石兽反而逆流而上了。

sentences.english: They both looked out through the window at the guests milling about in the yard.
sentences.chinese: 他们一起看向窗外，看着客人们在后院里转来转去。

sentences.english: The thou Ao eye pupil son turns around, one slavering of face facial expression.
sentences.chinese: 古傲眼珠子转来转去，一脸的垂涎表情。

sentences.english: Boemio casually walks around all of it, occasionally laughing.
sentences.chinese: 波密奥在这些东西周围转来转去，偶尔还笑笑。

sentences.english: She at home roves , is excited the cheeks to be bright red.
sentences.chinese: 她在家里转来转去，兴奋得脸颊飞红。

sentences.english: For some are already turned aside after Satan.
sentences.chinese: 因为已经有转去随从撒但的。

sentences.english: He had been beaten up and rolled.
sentences.chinese: 他受到毒打并被翻来转去地搜遍全身抢尽财物。

sentences.english: But all letters will be forwarded.
sentences.chinese: 不过所有的信都是可以转去的。

sentences.english: I watched in wonder as she ran circles around the other kids.
sentences.chinese: 看着她在其他孩子旁边兜来转去，我感到十分惊奇。

definition: to turn back/to put back/reversal/melodic inversion (in music)
to rove around/to run around in circles/to walk back and forth
to turn back/to retrace one's steps
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
to reassign sb to a different job/to turn around/to change direction/to make a U turn
to roll/to wander around/to appear repeatedly
to turn around
to spin/to rotate/to revolve
eyeball/fig. the apple of one's eye (i.e. favorite person)
to roll rapidly/to spin/Taiwan pr. [gu2 lu5]
to make a detour/to go by way of
to overdo it/to overstep the limit/excessively/above one's head/overhead
to go straight to/to make a beeline for
to stroll
old variant of 往[wang3]
to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous
meandering and circuitous (idiom); to go around in circles and never get anywhere
